description: This is the patient lifetime dose history information for tracked chemicals in Medication Options. This table displays the information from the Lifetime Dose Tracking activity for a specified patient. Total lifetime dose information is in PAT_LIFEDOSE.

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID assigned to the patient record. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reportingï¿½s security utility.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

columns.name: CHEMICAL_C_NAME
columns.description:
The chemical category ID for the chemical that needs to be tracked for lifetime dosing for this patient.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: LIFEDOSE_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The source ID for the chemical that needs to be tracked for lifetime dosing for this patient. Indicates how the chemical was recorded in the patient's record, such as eMAR or accumulative dose activity.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


eMAR


Manual Entry


Order

columns.name: INPATIENT_DATA_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the inpatient data store record, populated if LIFEDOSE_SOURCE_C is eMAR, which means we record tracked chemical in eMAR. You could get eMAR information from IP_MAR based on this and INPATIENT_DATA_LN.

columns.name: INPATIENT_DATA_LN
columns.description: If SOURCE_C is MAR, which means we record tracked chemical in eMAR, this is the corresponding line number that this line of chemical traced data related to.    You could get eMAR information from IP_MAR based on INPATIENT_DATA_ID and this.

columns.name: GIVEN_INST
columns.description: The instant that the dose of this line was given to the patient in eMAR.

columns.name: SIMP_DOSE_AMT
columns.description: The simplified dose amount for the chemical.

columns.name: SIMP_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The simplified dose unit category ID for the chemical that needs to be tracked for lifetime dosing for this patient.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries:

columns.name: CALC_DOSE_AMT
columns.description: The calculated dose amount for the chemical.

columns.name: CALC_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The calculated dose unit category ID for the chemical that needs to be tracked for lifetime dosing for this patient.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: SIMP_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME

columns.name: WEIGHT
columns.description: The patient's weight used to calculate dose for the chemical at time of administration.

columns.name: HEIGHT
columns.description: The patient's height used to calculate dose for the chemical at time of administration.

columns.name: USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who entered chemical data, populated if SOURCE_C is manual.

columns.name: LIFEDOSE_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The status category ID for this chemical that needs to be tracked for lifetime dosing in this row.  It will be "1-ACTIVE" normally, and can be changed to "2-CANCELLED" if the chemical administration that corresponds to this row is cancelled.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active


Canceled


Edited


Deleted

columns.name: COMMENT_INFO
columns.description: A free-text comment entered for lifetime dose tracking, if any exists.

columns.name: EMAR_LINE
columns.description: If a manual entry is created to adjust the dose for an eMAR (electronic Medical Administration Record) line, then the original eMAR line is stored here.

columns.name: ORDER_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique order ID where this line of administered chemical came from.

columns.name: FILED_INST
columns.description: The instant that a manual adjusted entry line is stored.

columns.name: REVIEW_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The review status category ID for lifetime dose after merging or unmerging a patient record, or moving information from one patient's record to another patient's record.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Need Review


Accepted


Rejected

columns.name: REVIEWED_USER_ID
columns.description: Specify the user who reviewed the entry for lifetime dose after patient merge, unmerge, or contact move.

columns.name: REVIEWED_DTTM
columns.description: The date and time when the lifetime dose review is done after merging or unmerging a patient record, or moving information from one patient's record to another patient's record.

columns.name: REVIEW_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description:
The review reason category ID for why the chemical for this row needs review.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Patient Merge


Patient Unmerge


Patient Contact Move

columns.name: LIFEDOSE_PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the procedure which is the source for the manually-entered dose.

columns.name: SURGERY_CSN
columns.description: The unique ID of the surgical contact which is associated with a procedure log where radiation exposure was documented. Use this column to join to PAT_OR_ADM_LINK.PAT_ENC_CSN_ID and the invasive procedure log ID can be found in the column LOG_ID.

columns.name: ENTRY_HAS_INCOMPLETE_DATA_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the associated entry has incomplete dosing information that may need further review. 'Y' indicates there is incomplete dosing information.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes
